"Kuusen Madoushi Kouhosei no Kyoukan" or "Sky Wizards Academy" is one of those cliche animes with a cool main character, in this case Kanata, who just seems to meet girls in a weird situation and is inevitably forced to work together with them towards a similar goal. 
Like said, the story resolves around Kanata Age, a traitor as everyone calls him, who is assigned as the instructor of team E601 to win the Sky Wizards tournament in order for them to not be disbanded. What's the catch? The team is utterly useless, having suffered 10 losses in a row. With an incredibly shy girl Lecty,a self-taught "goddess" Rico and a leader who can't really lead Misora, what is gonna happen? Well, find out yourself.


Story wise, as most of the action/drama animes, it lacks. Work towards goal, not working out, gradually working out, big bad guy, defeat big bad guy, good end. There wasn't any real emotional attachment given to the characters, so if someone died, you wouldn't have really felt anything. 


Now, the artwork. I can't really complain. I enjoyed the artstyle used and fancied the backgrounds. Characters were nicely made. I really took a liking to a few of the characters for the looks, but that was as much of a liking as you can get in this.


Soundwise it's not bad, but it's not overly good. The voices were okay.


Enjoyment. I typically enjoy these shows just for the comedy and action, since you can't usually feel the drama. What brough the enjoyment of this one down were the action scenes. They were literally so boring I went into the kitchen to make a sandwich just to not watch them. Another good example of this would Seiken Tsukai no World Break. There wasn't any real emotion behind any of the fighting. I can still say I enjoyed it, but it could've been a lot better.


If it's so cliche and bad, why are you rating this a whole 8 out of 10? 

Well, I am a sucker for anime such as this one.

(Know that this is only about the anime and not the light novel) After seeing all the reviews and it being recced on my anime page I had to see it and I expected it to not be to my liking, now honestly I'm more disappointed with it. I do like this anime and I think it could have been good if it wasn't thanks to possibly multiple things like not having enough episodes to flush things out that needed it or they were banking on people going to some manga or novel source where it comes from to get the money. Whatever it wasit I don't know, but this anime was something I know could have been better if handled right all the way through.


1. The story - I think people only saw this as a harem sort of anime, probably because of the cliches showing on top, but when I watched this it's not really and the only ones who showed interest in the MC like that was Misora and Yuri who outright loved the guy. 

This is actually an underdog story like the movies some of us grew up with let's see if you can see the tropes: 1. There's a bunch of misfits with personal problems in an area that they are outclassed in by others around them and no one believes in them. 2. A badass top tier that has been shamed by his soon to be justified actions becomes their teacher due to circumstances. 3. They have a rocky meet. 4. They train in their interest sucking at first and in their personal lives to overcome their own inner weaknesses. 5. They are challenged by the higher than them antagonist the whole way. 6. In the first official competition they get into they lose. 7. After a bit more training, the team is ACTUALLY ready for the upcoming tournament. 8. They win in the next one and rise through the ranks in montage and then their main antagonist opponents are last to overcome and they win. 

Does this NOT sound familiar to you now? Do you SEE what I'm talking about now? That's what this actually is no matter what anyone but me tells ya  because I pretty much summed this whole thing up beat for beat and since I like this kind of story I think it's good.


2. The art - The art is ok, it's nothing stellar, nothing you really say is the best thing about it though I give them some credit on their use of CGI on the monster enemy from hell, it's no Fate Stay Night nor is it Rakuen Tsuihou. It's right on the average middle that's good for anime. Special note on the way they die, it is glorious to see I recommend looking at the opening episode just to see how that it. The people's anime is anime hair, faces are faces, the things I like most though is the weapons which are, like RWBY and unlike it, are to the owners design and interesting to look at, but they aren't also a gun.


3. The sound - In terms of VAs it's all around fine, the background music is pretty MMORPG-like, boom when action is there, light and flutes and violins all around when there's character time. It's pretty ok.


4. The character - The characters are of their own trope and cliches: Kanata Age: He used to be the best, but thanks to things happening he's now known as a traitor. So to redeem himself, he has to make the worst team of Sky Wizards in terms of grades and skills a skilled and powerful one. Despite being marked a traitor, Kanata works earnestly to help out his girls and as a teacher fitting a trope he is a good one. He has an annoying habit though in that he forgets to mention crucial stuff to people before it actually happens.


Misora Whitail, she's the tsundere and after a very harem-like meeting with Kanata the two are off to bad start, but don't let that fool you. While her character may look simplistic or unattractive for some, the reason she fights and her dreams are what makes her genuine. Living with her Muggle dad and neighbors when her mom die (Disney notes taken) they don't remember her existing at all (Not explained deeper in the anime) and it conflicts on Misora and her dad's relationship, but this is also what drives her to use her mom's blade gun and become a great Sky Wizard, to be a reminder to those who don't remember her that she was great and amazing.


Lecty, she has the highest potential to fuck your shit up in a fight, her only problem though is that she's incredibly shy and lacks confidence thus ruining her potential. Once you get to know the pressure she has, when you know where she comes from, it all becomes understandable. You even start to sympathize with her if you yourself have been there. Over the course of the show, it constantly puts her in what can be seen as fanservice moments, but it's a different kind of fanservice that actually HELPS the character to grow and works in the plot around her.


Rico, the self-proclaimed goddess of the group. She believes that she is the perfect human being, in terms of looks and skill there's no counter. Never forget, everybody has their weakness and Rico isn't an exception. No matter how she tries to play it off, she isn't perfect, in fact, it's her inferiority of her sister that lead her into this arrogant way of thinking that gave her this mind process. Her growth comes in the form of letting her inner-self come out and being able to work with her team and getting over the loser mentality that she doesn't let known.


By the end of the series it all comes to a helm with all of the characters better than they were before and on greater terms with each other and the payoff is needing to be seen. 


5. My enjoyment - I typically like series like this one and as I said before I like it, but am disappointed by it as well. The villains needed better explanation done onto them, one of them is needlessly made into a villain when he didn't have to be, and the end of them tournament is astounding. I will be rewatching this again though since it's still fresh in my mind and I want to take another look at it with the knowledge I have while making this review and I hope some of you also acquire this mindset when looking at it or looking at it again. 


That's it.

A very nice and fun anime. A team of warrior trainees is on the edge of being dismantled as a result of poor match results. A weird teacher tries and in time succeeds to transform the members into a real team and such ave the ability to win matches. The only problem is that the show never explains the premise of the anime: where did the bugs come from? why are they attacking humans? how do the humans get the weapons? what is the connection between bugs and humans? what are the bugs? Nothing is explained and unless a second seasons will be made nothingapparently will.

This anime is one of the worst I've ever seen. I quite literally wanted to kill myself after I finished it. Don't watch this show whatever you do. 
Story 1/10:
I barfed at this story. It is the most stereotypical story I've ever seen. The plot sort of makes sense with Fireteam (why tf is it called a fireteam?) E601 trying to become the best but they play it out so horribly that you just want to kill whoever the writer of this story was. Seriously, the plot just goes jumping around from the MC trying to get the girls to cooperate to some weird scientistwho is obsessed with some girl named Yuri. I really hated those interactions since they where awkward and that guy just kept obsessing over her to the point of a just wanting to drop the anime completely. Some animes do this amazingly but this is just at the bottom of the bucket. The world itself also makes no sense at all. Like why do they need to make an island where the humans can hide? Why not make it like God Eater or Attack on Titan with walls surrounding cities as building a giant freakin floating island sounds like more work than building a wall to protect them. What happened to the world? How did the humans let giant bugs take over the planet? How did these things happen? It overall is just a poor excuse for a story. It feels like some 3rd grader fresh out of watching AOT & SAO comes and is like "Oh, I love SAO & AOT and I want to put them together. I know!!! Lets take the floating island of SAO along with the weapons, and the plot of AOT and make a brain-dead version of the show. Sounds like a great idea!!!" Well this is the product of that. The ending of this show is just disappointing to me although what did I expect with all the complaints I had above. I'm not even going to say what the ending was because it was so bad, just trying to remember it just makes my brain hurt. 


Art 3/10:

The animation is as I would put it, like the animators had the budget of a student animating stick figure videos and putting them on Youtube. The animation is so slow and choppy. You can really see it in the opening song. The animation is like playing COD at 5fps. Even looking at one of those old Stickman videos on Youtube or most other animations on the internet are better animated than this. The backgrounds I would say are drawn okay. Looks like some 7th grader or me drew it though. Pretty much any anime beats the animation in this anime with a few exceptions. I really don't like the style of art in this anime either. It's just bland, and there is nothing special about it. 


Sound 4/10: 

The sound in this anime is not the worst. It's not bad it's not good. Opening is one of the worst openings I've ever seen. The song is just really bad overall in my opinion and the animation is horrible. The ending isn't that bad but none of the songs or OST would ever make it in a top video. 


Characters 1/10:

Oh god the characters, why the characters.... (Note: I forgot the names of the characters because they were so bad) First of all, the MC bland. He has like no character. He has pretty much no backstory. He is also super OP and that's pretty much it about him, a bland dude who I forget the name of because he was that bland. Now onto the Harem. 


Red-Haired Girl: 

Some stereotypical girl that no one likes. So cliche in every way. She has some backstory but it's still bad just like the rest of the plot. If I could, I would just kill her off as soon as possible. Such a boring character in the end.


Blond Girl:

Big chested shy girl. Super super shy and obviously falls for the MC for no reason. 


Kami Girl:

Just as the title suggest, she is a girl who thinks of herself as a goddess. Any redeeming qualities about this girl? No


Yuri (I think that's her name):

I don't know why I remember this girl's name but I think it's from that weird scientist obsession with her. She likes the MC because this is a harem but really. No redeeming qualities about her either. 


Antagonists:

The giant bugs....

Giant bugs are the antagonist of this anime? I think this would have fit in way better in a show such as One Punch Man. They barely appear in this show for being antagonist and just are horrible. 


Scientist:

This creepy guy who for some reason loves Yuri after smelling a tissue she dropped. It makes no sense what so ever. It's like me falling in love with some random girl from smelling her skin. The only time I've seen an anime pull off something like this is when Tsukiyama (Tokyo Ghoul) smells that blood stained tissue and wants to eat Kaneki. He has no development at all and is overall a horrible antagonist. 


Enjoyment 1/10:

From all the given above, you probably can tell how I feel about this anime. I really hated this anime and had no enjoyment in watching it. I felt like killing myself at the end of this because I really hated this so much. There is no re-watch value or anything in this anime at all. I love plot and characters, and as long as those are good, I can live with everything else being terrible but this was just absolutely horrifying. I feel like this shouldn't even exist, that's how bad this is. 


Overall 1/10:

Just stay away from this anime. If anyone tells you to watch this, they must have been shot in the head as they are brain-dead for even trying to make you watch this load of crap. I will never ever recommend this anime to anyone. It's so bad that it could be quite literally one of the worst animes ever created. It's on that level of don't watch because it's so bad, your eyes will melt out of their sockets like watching School Days or Boku no Pico. Just don't even attempt this watch. There is no redeeming value in watching this anime. Just run away from this anime. Save yourself from this crap.

Enjoyment/overall: 7/10

Found it interesting to watch. It wasn't as bad as everyone said it was and found it to be interesting near the end.

This is my first review so please bear with me.
At first look, this anime seems like a typical harem anime, but there's a reason why harem isn't in the genres: THIS ISN'T HAREM. When I first saw this anime, I put it off because it looked too much like a harem anime (the 1 guy and 3 girls on the cover), but I regret my decision because this anime is AWESOME. Don't mind the haters, this anime has great story, nice art, and nice sounds. The only part that I would have liked to see more of would be character development, but you can onlydo so much in 12 episodes so considering that, it's pretty nice. There weren't any noticeable quality drops, unlike the more mainstream anime of the summer 2015 season Ex: Rokka no Yuusha and as a normal heterosexual guy, I cannot resist the cuteness of Yuri, even up to the last few minutes when she does something thats a big spoiler (maybe not if you've been paying attention to what shows on her face when talking to a certain someone). Overall, it was a great anime that I looked forwards to watching every week.

In order for people reading this review, to get a fully fledged understanding of my relation with this anime - I will here quote my first words upon just completing the last episode.
"Well that was f***ing dreadful*
And thus, let the review begin:
First of a short "summary" - Sky Wizards Academy appeared to me when I watched it's first episode only 10 minutes after HD release as something I actually had been looking forward to, the synopsis for the anime seemed rather promising and thus I had high hopes. Hopes that by the first episode was absolutely demolished beyond repair, yet to write a proper reviewwithout having seen all episodes is unfair to the series and it's creator(s) so I pulled myself trough the remaining of this car crash so I could leave this entry without feeling bad or speaking without having seen all that the anime had to offer.

Sky Wizards Academy also became "hard" to judge - as it was not one of these 3-5 min skit animes nor one of the 10 min short's - I feel obliged to give it a full and most proper review rather than "It was bad but made me giggle here and there so it gets 5/10" like a 3-5 min skit anime could.


So let's break this into the different aspects, starting with the story -


- Story: The story of Sky Wizards Academy was most likely the thing about this anime that STARTED of as the best element they had. Now it's not to stick under a chair that the main story line was cliche: 

"Earth destroyed by *Insert said thing here* (Devil Beetles)" 

"Humanity retreats to a city / cities in the sky for safety reasons" 

"Some Humans are born with the strength to fight said *Insert said thing here* - and thus named Sky wizards" 

"We are following one team in particular that struggles with that they can't get along properly and that they all seem horrible at what they should be doing" 

"In comes random hero from sometime in history and teaches them how to be better" 

"The team does not like him, then they do, then they hate him, then they don't"

It's nothing new but it's not BAD either if portrayed the right way with the right characters - Which is exactly what Sky Wizards Academy managed to screw up so badly. But let's not head to the characters just yet - back to the story:

So with a story that ALL ALONE and BY ITSELF would be more than fine for a season, you know - some more time into each aspect of training, team VS teacher" and so on, but then they HAD to go on and bring in the most ridiculous "side story" ever seen before my eyes and then go on and make THAT the main part of the anime. No one EVER want's to see a story starting to revolt around some creepy stalker of a geezer that takes to "desperate measures" to obtain his love, I mean come on. That ALONE ruined this anime and I can with certainty say that this anime would have been way better of if it didn't ever introduce us to creepy stalker guy.

And WORST of all, the whole "Traitor" aspect. We got introduced to it: "Oh he is a traitor"but it wasn't even HINTED to WHY, HOW or WHEN, this made for a bunch of characters ALL over the place bringing the mood down as they all seemed salty over something we never got EXPLAINED. Sure the last episode gave a CLUE but never was there a sturdy answer to said "Why. how and when"


Story: 2/10 for piss poor performance and execution.


- Art: Where do I even start, I might was well pick out the only few positive aspects as they can be counted on my one hand - majorly the art here was terrible. The phasing was rather way to slow or way to fast, the character's didn't look lively at all or seemed as if they tried to hard in looking alive, the CGI with the Devil Beetles was so bad it had me tearing my hair out - and the combat scenes was just horrible beyond imagination or at worst: CGI animated. And when they first managed to get things looking good, it was on idle side characters or frozen frames of the main characters doing nothing - in addition a great deal of the art was bland, focused on the wrong aspects and worst of all - so poorly made that they just made the "main focus" of the shot a small detail in the corner and seemingly aiming for that people would look on the "pretty" background instead.


Art: 2/10 - Since a 1 would only be in store had the full thing been in Devil Beetle CGI style.


- Sound: The most positive aspect all in all in the middle of this total wreck, I did not find the songs played in the background to be bad nor good, they managed to make it suit most scenes and the mood in general. A few hiccups here and there, specially with that "ping" sound they seem to love. but other than that the sound department did their job and should be rewarded for bringing SOME decency in the middle of all the other chaos.


Sound: 4/10 - It was part of what kept me going in the long run.


- Characters: My first thought after meeting the main crew of 4 was as split into two halves.

1: Oh lord I am already hating these girls and I am sure that they will haunt my dreams.

2: At least Kirito is here to make me smile as he usually does his job well and seems to be a carefree character, which might just keep me tuned.

And this divided train of thought was SPOT on. I spent the remainders of the anime in agony, watching what could have been awesome and lovable characters appear to me as some of the most annoying and obnoxious set people ever seen in the world of anime. I even had my girlfriend next to me for about 20% of the total run time of this anime, she could not hear it, only read the texting and even SHE found them so bad it was making her sick - That right there is a message when only 20% run time of characters you can't even HEAR makes you cringe.

THANKFULLY - Kirito, I mean Kanata, was there all along as a carefree, funny bastard that made me smile when things was going down. doing a splendid job on holding me alive as I watched trough this series.


Characters: 3/10 - You keep em smiling Kirito.


- Enjoyment: This is where things got scary, I pained myself trough each episode with the final goal of it all being to deliver a crushing blow to it all, setting fire to the car wreck, salting the wound, I was looking forward to that during this entire animes run time. While doing so I decided to play a bit "Cinema Sins" of YouTube and pointed out everything wrong in each episode and this helper on the overall enjoyment as well, making me still notice all the horrible part but still being able to enjoy it.


Enjoyment: 3/10 - Finding mistakes has never been more fun. But that still does not make it a good thing to be honest.


To finish this all - I would like to say that this is not an anime I recommend at all, you want to avoid watching this like the plague if you know what's better for you.


And that's it for my review on Sky Wizards Academy, thank you all so much for reading and most of all - For your time. If a season two for this ever is announced you can be damn sure I will suffer myself trough that one as well since delivering hammers like this is something I could live and die for.


Total score roundup - 3/10.

Hello, this is my first review on this site, so I'd like you all to keep that in mind. I have reviewed other anime, but that was on my facebook page.
WARNING! WARNING! SPOILERS MAY BE PRESENT IN REVIEW!
Story: 8/10
For story I gave it an 8/10 for a good reason. While many may disagree with me on the score, I feel it is well deserved. For one, the anime did impressively well at fleshing out as much as it could in only 12 episodes while also not overflowing or underwhelming us with information about the series. They; introduced the threat of the anime, showed why they'rea threat, made us aware of the main characters and their backstories, fleshed out the relationships they had with other characters, explained plot points about sky wizards (such as how non-sky wizards lose their memories of sky wizards who die), and still managed to give us just enough. However, being that it is only 12 episodes long, there were a few things off.

        For one, the Sky Beetles. They are the main enemies of the series, but we don't learn very much about them except that they're apparently really powerful and attack in swarms, but retreat if their commander is killed. We do not learn of their origins, nor do we learn of what figure head seems to really command them except for "chimeras" who act as generals. There's too many questions to be asked.

        My next issue is that we also know very little about the sky wizards themselves. How did they come into existence?  Where does their magic/power come from? Why do "naturals" forget about them when they die? I have to go a little easy on the series, though, because none of these questions for either the beetles or the sky wizards are the focus of the series. 

        Rather, the focus of the series are three girls who make up a squad of failures, and it's up to a young man branded a traitor despite once being hailed as an elite. (He was branded a traitor because he refused to return to battle; The truth is revealed that after a very tough battle, Kanata was almost defeated in battle but instead gained powers of the Sky Beetles, the anime's main enemies. He didn't want others to find out.) So most of it focuses on them while feeding us more about other issues that exist in the anime. The Sky Beetles do play an important role, kind of, in the end but this is mostly plot driven. Granted it was developed over several episodes. I'd go on, but the rest will be talked about in my character section.


Art: 9/10

The artwork for this anime is very nice to look at. The dynamic colors and how it helps distinguish background and character designs I thought did a good job at making things easy on the eyes. However, I fear I cannot go further as my opinion on art is exactly that, opinion. I can't say with confidence that it is unbiased.


Sound: 6/10

Believe it or not, the soundtrack for the anime was pretty decent. It helped create the mood during several scenes. It really made me feel the kind of pressure the main girls were under, and it also made me feel excited when things were going well. However, I have to admit that sometimes the soundtrack was lacking a bit and I barely noticed it. 


Character: 8/10

The anime is focused on four main characters, as well as several other characters who interact with our main four. I have to say, not a single character felt like they fit one particular archetype. This is especially since the characters develop so well. Each one changes in their own way, and each character has their own identity and quirks that make them unique. Sure, some of them retain some early characteristics, but they truly grow and overcome things in their lives thanks to one another. Each character has something to make you care about them, and I feel that there aren't any weak characters in the series. They pushed you to feel something for them, be it a desire to see them eat their words or the drive to cheer them on. That's what characters should do, drive emotion out of you and onto them, and it is exactly what they did. 

     Take Lepty for example. She starts out super shy yet determined, but by the end of the series though she may be shy, she can also look her opponents in the eyes and not hesitate like she used to.

     Even more satisfying was watching the four main characters grow and bond as a team, more so for the three girls bonding as a team and learning to trust each other and their instructor. 


Enjoyment: 9/10

I truly enjoyed the series. I do hope that the show gets a second season as it left a bit to be desired, though not to its own fault. This is definitely something I would recommend to anyone looking for something short and enjoyable. It is action packed, has fun and engaging characters, and has pretty nice artwork. The characters are easily the strongest suit.


Overall: 8/10

I've said plenty of what I feel I needed to say. Good story, good art, lackluster soundtrack, well developed characters, and high entertainment value. Many may disagree with my score, but I say give the anime a chance. Come into it with an open mind, but don't forget that everything comes with a bias, even people who try to be as in the middle as possible with their reviews.

As for me personally, I should have enjoyed anime's like this, I mean a story about underdogs, an mistrusted teacher and a group of girls that is considered the worst, they make a the perfect underdog team but why?
The main reason for me giving this a low score is the fact that despite having an intresting plot, they focused more on the fan service, plus In my opinion, they should have focused more on the girls overcoming all the odds instead of this Real Nua guy whom i think is forced just to make Kanata look great, well in fact he is already, plus thewhole reason for him turning evil is OUT OF LOVE?!?!?! \n
'\n
if there's one thing I enjoyed here it's the main cast, like I said, them overcoming all the odds was a fun watch, It just sucks they didn't get the respect they deserve, plus there's an unanswered question with regarding Misora, the romance part did nothing (particularly with Yuri and Real) as it done nothing more but ruin the story.\n\n
Overall this was a fun ride until the later parts where it was rushed crammed and bad but if you're into the fan service then you might enjoy this.

Kuusen Madoushi Kouhosei no Kyoukan seemed like a great anime initially, but after watching it, I've come to the conclusion that it is one of the worst animes I have ever watched. It was so bad that I immediately came here to write a review about how terrible it actually was. Lets begin....
The Story: The story is a giant mess and the plots are even worse. There is literally no background story at all. We dont know what happened to Earth, all we know is that it was taken over by giant beetles and now we have magic. As for the plots, they normally comeout of thin air (just like the beetles) and usually never get solved. Overall, its a mess and will probably be lost by the 5th episode.


The Art: Holy crap! The animation in this anime is so low budget, you could have sworn they ran out of money mid way. At one point, the characters would just fly by the enemy invaders (wouldn't even swing their swords) and they would explode into a puff of white smoke. True, some scenes were excellently done, but the majority of the fight scenes were cringe worthy


The Sound: My only complaint was the annoying chanting that goes on during some scenes. It was a weird combination of the opening of Frozen and the opening song of Lilo and Stitch. 


The Characters: The main character was honestly my favorite. He reminded me of a mixture of  Layfon from Chromed Shelled Regios and Kirito from SAO. If it wasn't for him, I would have ditched this anime at episode 6. Now lets talk about the main antagonist. This villian is literally so hatable/annoying that you will wish you could just kill him right on the spot. Im not talking about Cell (from DBZ) hatable where you hate his actions but he's actually pretty cool. I'm talking about down right annoying to the bone. The main villain was so annoying that I would rather listen the Sesame Street theme song, sang by Rebecca Black, on repeat for 10 hours than watching this stupid morphed cockroach talk about his sociopathical problems. Seriously, THIS DUDE RUINED THE SHOW! 


Overall: Honestly, between the plot holes, skipping major fights, bad animation, and HORRIBLE characters, I gave this anime a 2/10. Never before has an anime LITERALLY CAUSED ME PAIN TO FINISH IT!! If you dont believe me, go check it out for yourself.

I want to start off by saying: I was overwhelmed by how much i enjoyed, to a certain extent. This is anime is beautiful. The story's good and the art has an array of vivid and normal colours. (The vivid colours mostly refer to the characters hair, but that's whatever.)
So here we go.
Story:
There isn't anything that particular stands out in the plot but, I did like the way it brought life to the characters and hinted at certain aspects of characters that seemed irregular and made for some interesting development. The fanservice is there, mostly in the changing rooms, but it shouldn't be considered allthat big of a hindrance to those who dislike that kind of "plot".


Art:

The art is lovely and smooth. I love the vivid colour of Misora's hair, I think thats what sold the art for me. Otherwise the art is ok but nothing particularly special for its time.


Sound:

All anime of great sound so much to comment on other than sometimes the intermission/segment/half-way-point music can play a tune that doesn't particularly go with the current mood though some anime do that so I didn't penalize it too much in that regard.


Characters:

The characters are somewhat stereotypical for a group of people in most anime: OP main, someone who only cares about themselves, some who's too shy for their own good and bunch or others like a Tsundere heroine.


Enjoyment:

Despite it's flaw's, I actually really like this one so I think, to me, my score for that aspect is relevant.


Overall:

If you're looking for an anime with great artwork, an alright story, a bit of fan-service, some character development and people who fights evil bugs with magic, this will probably sit well with you. However if you're a dub person, I'm sorry but steer clear. I know this review views it in a somewhat positive light but, the English Dub switches out Lecty's voice actresses between Episodes 7 and 8. Kind of disappointing but no much we can do about it.

Welp this is basically that same harem action anime that comes every anime season. You constantly see ones like this but in different names such as "Seirei Tsukai no Blade Dance", Seikoku no Dragonar, Absolute Duo and many many more. And a lot of these turn out mediocre and but some turn out good. This unfortunately was the latter. It has an extremely clique story, mediocre action and just awful characters in the for front.
Story-
 Basically this story revolves around acadamy were "devil bugs" are attacking the world and students learn how to fight them in teams. Sound good so far....yea no well it getsbetter. We spend 90% of the anime trying to teach 3 girls who are the worst students how to be better.....yea thats fun..


Characters-

Male MC

Probably the worst thing about this anime holy crap! Basically We have an Male MC who has some past where hes called a traitor now but he used to be the strongest or something. Hes assign to teach these girls how to be a better team. Honestly hes the only redeemable character in this story. His mystery past and personally is the ONLY thing that got me to watch this as far as i did. Still he has his own problems and its the one most male MCs have in harem anime and its that there pushovers to the women. In this anime there are a lot of people bashing him calling him a traitor and stuff and he just takes it with a smile. I wish for once people can act like people and defend themselves. This is especially prevalent for females in this and other series. A girl can talk all the shit they want or even try to kill the MC at a point (in Dragonar academy) and the MC will still act like its not her fault cause shes a cute girl. its ridiculous.  Now the 3 Main female characters.

Female MCs

Holy shit if they didnt choose the worst female cast ever holy shit. One (the red head) is your classic overly done bitchy, hot headed, i hate the male lead but randomly like him too, tsundere character. She is that clique to a "T". Plus she had some stupid story were she was forcing herself to learn a fighting style that the MC teacher said was impossible for her to improve with especially after all her years of training. Yet she randomly gives him a sad backstory and he says i can teach you it now....WTF kind of bull is that.

Next we have an EXTREMELY annoying, whiny, insecure, crybaby shy girl (the blond). Her constant shy voice is SOOO irritating throughout the anime holy crap. I couldnt stand her and every thing she says or does has to have some kind of shy studdering. It always takes a while for her do say anything which was infuriating.

Lastly and by far the worst one in my opinion was An extremely pompous, head in her own ass, narcissistic girl (the long blacked haired one). She calls self a goddess for some past reason and treats people like crap, acts lazy and doesnt help with anything cause of it. Her attitude was so damn annoying in this and i couldnt take it every times she talked. So yea put all this annoying characters in one story and you got yourself one huge shit show. I mean i understand that part of the point of this anime was to help them be a better team and better people but frankly they all havent really changed at all till the end even. they have moments where they act a bit better but just go back to doing what they all do. And were suppose to like these characters yea no.

Others-

There are a few side characters but most make no real impact in this anime. There some that just bash the MC calling him a traitor and one girl whos exactly like the Red head tsundere. She treats him like crap but likes him.


Over all-

As you can see i didnt enjoy this lame ass anime. I mean the first 5 or 6 episodes were just trying to fix this annoying girls team work by doing random crap like maid cafes or listening to back stories and in the end they still were the same and still lost the next event. Then the rest was some side filler like story of this tournament and this yandere guy. I mean all i cared about was hearing the male MCs back story but i couldnt stomach watching this consistently anymore and i had to wait till it was finished to breeze through. This is lame, forgettable and a wast of anyone's time

Only writing this to help others have a good mind set going into it.  I kind of held off because I saw a bunch of 1-3's but It is not.  It will be if you go into it with the wrong mind set.  This is not really a harem.  He is not after the girls and most are not after him.  Their is fan service, but the main lead is hardly ever their for it.  All of his students are all aiming for something, and he is trying to help them.
Story:  Pretty basic, but well executed.  Nojumps in logic.  Nothing is done for shocker value.  Though that is not normally done in this genre. Ending also wrapped up nicely which is always important.


Art:  I would say it was rather enjoyable.  I am not really that interested in art style as long as it is above a certain threshold I hardly notice it.  This was fairly well done and I had no complaints.


Sound: it was all well done as well, though the suspenseful "holy shit this is happening" music was always the same.  By the end you instantly knew when something was about to turn solely based on the music.  Voiced were amazing though.


Characters:  They are all shown first episode basically.  You get a really good idea of who they really are and what flaws they have.  They all get a good amount of air time as they solve their issues and grow stronger.


Enjoyment:  I enjoyed it but I have no idea why anyone would care that I enjoyed it.  I would say if you watch the first three episodes and are not enjoying it drop it.  The first one can paint a false picture.  The second kind of gets you to realize what it really is.  Then by the third you get it.


Overall:  I would watch a second season.


If you want a story about the weak and misunderstood growing to become strong but still unappreciated yet they are still fine with it, this might just be for you.

Who dared you to look at this show? ...Huh? You weren't dared? Okay, well, who forced you to look at this show? ...WHAT? You weren't forced to research it? Then why the hell are you paying attention to this show? Kuusen Madoushi Kouhosei No Kyoukan is one of the worst shows I have ever seen, and the show on my list with the lowest rating. I am usually passive about the anime I watch, with most scoring 7-10, but this show.... this one deserves the score of a 3. 
If you haven't got the hint yet from all the reviews above mine, this show isabsolutely terrible. The question to why the MC "betrayed" the academy is answered in the last episode, leaving you wondering the whole show why they call him a traitor. We only see him fight about 3 times throughout the show, once in the prologue, a second when the beetle shitters attacked, and a third at the last episode. That's it. I mean, come on, if you're gonna have an overpowered main character you could at least show him fighting more. The show leaves most of the fighting up to the three girls who all end up liking the generic OP main character (although the show denies all ties to the harem genre) in the end of the show. Another point of the main character, the formula he was made with makes him seem all cool, but he's one of those characters who try too hard to be cool. One of those, "Oh, I saw you naked but i'm just gonna say put some clothes on," or one of those, "Oh, you're naked in the bed and I know you are? How about I keep staring like I don't notice you're naked?" To get my point across, the main character is one of the worst in the industry. 


  On to the heroines! Every review I read has a segment talking about how bad the girls are. I will change it up. Instead, I will talk about the good part of the heroines (Red head, Blonde, Bitch: as I like to call them) because if you want bad parts, go read the other reviews.


                                 Only one of them is cute.


Okay, done talking about the heroines! Next, lets talk about how shitty the animation is! The devil beetles (or shitters, as I like to call them) were done poorly, not looking flashy at all. They rarely show up during the show, other than (Just like how frequently the MC fights!) in the beginning, the middle, and the end. Actually, scratch that! They don't appear in the end of the show. For the whole show being centered around fighting them, they sure do show up a lot huh? I forgot we were talking about the animation and not how bad the antagonists are. The way the characters fly is so, so bad I closed my eyes every time they move. It looks like someone paused the show, dragged the character from one side of the screen to the other slowly, then resumed the show. Also, how the heck do the devil shitters appear en masse when the characters blow them up in hundreds?! Apparently they regenerate in a mothership somewhere, although the reason the devil beetles came and destroyed earth is not given at any point throughout the show.


Next, it's story time. LOL, get it? There is no story. I can describe the story in three sentences. 1. Kanata is overpowered and some event of the past turned him into a "traitor" (which i've seen this formula a lot. Main characters who are treated like the worst but secretly they're the best [Rakudai Kishi No Cavalry, The Asterisk War, etc.]) 2. To redeem himself he is given command of the worst fireteam, being set up for failure on purpose. 3. He makes them the best fireteam. BOOM. THREE SENTENCES. THAT'S THE WHOLE PLOT.  I COULDN'T GIVE YOU SPOILERS IF I WANTED TO.


Finally, the killing blow to this angry review, the conclusion. Kuusen Madoushi Kouhosei no Kyoukan is one of the worst shows you can find. Watching this will only make you want to order a 5-pack of Clorox bleach off of Amazon. It's also a poor excuse for a harem. The only thing that is REMOTELY good about the show, is the opening. I hate the ending. Skip it every time I hear the beginning. The opening is at least worthy of my ears, but the opening animation sucks, so I usually just listen to it with only audio. Anyway, the show is horrible. Animation sucks, plot development doesn't exist, sound is meh, enjoyment, ENJOYMENT? Is that what you think I got from this show? This show put me in crippling depression for a day! I would enjoy watching a mainstream anime over this shitfest of a show. Enjoyment is a 1. You're lucky there is no -10 Kuusen...


Aha! I finally figured out why you're looking at the reviews of this show! You were tortured into it, weren't you? I knew the government had some secret torturing tactics to get people to talk.

[Portuguese-BR] Demorei para assistir mais assisti, sinceramente não foi ruim, mas também não foi bom.

Relatively moderate review this time, nothing too fancy but I do think this anime deserves a review since it did intrigue me quite a bit! I'm doing a review on Sky Wizard's Academy, an anime based around a protagonist, Kanata Age, that has recently been black listed a traitor due to his inactivity with his duty to protect his home of Mistgun. In his blacklisting, he winds up becoming an instructor for a group of misfit students that are considered the lowest of the students, as they still have yet to win a single match against any of their opponents.
So I'm going to start withthe story as it is probably the only thing actually holding this anime together unfortunately. While I really enjoyed the story and the way the plot held itself together, I feel like I know nothing that I want to know. I never really received any answers for anything that I might have been curious about or really had any part of where these antagonistic beings called the "Devil Beetles" came from, which honestly leaves me a little sad and truly desiring more from the story. In all honestly, as much as I feel like I didn't learn anything, I do feel extremly held together by the lack of information making me want to create my own story line, which, I do feel saved this anime significantly.



Sounds check out next as I feel they did alright with the voice actors, as I feel like I couldn't really put any other voices to fit the characters better than they do. I guess the lack of actual emotion in the anime makes it hard for me to feel that they truly fit does play a factor into it but I think they did alright portraying the character they way they were meant to be heard. As for action scenes and all the sounds that follow a sword and a rifle, they failed. Nothing sounded like it fit or didn't even make a sound at all which made following the fighting rather difficult. The intro song was amazing. I never skipped as it always made me feel ready and wanting to get the anime going. The outro on the other hand, I skipped every time after the first episode. I didn't really enjoy it.



Well, now with the animation, I don't think it did too bad but the CGI was awful. Nothing connected, every movement was way to stiff, and all the colors changed during the switches. And than to try and counter this issue, they stopped using CGI and just made the fights really slow and rather actually quite dull using just the normal animation. It went from bad to worse. But hey, I guess all the looks of the characters weren't bad. I did like their models and enjoyed their hairstyles and the look of their eyes quite a bit.



Character development was pretty foul.  While every character learned and progressed forward, it looked like they were just shooting in the dark and getting lucky. Nothing really connected to me to say that it made sense. Harder than that, none of the characters had back stories besides Misora, so it really felt forced and just pulled together. Nothing really impressive to say about it, sorry to say.



Despite this, I did enjoy the anime. I don't really understand why I enjoyed it so much, maybe it just had a feel of something I enjoyed in the past, but never the less, I did enjoy it. Watching the characters struggle and try to figure out what was going on made it a pretty good story, as rough as it was and since the characters didn't really have their backstories, maybe I enjoyed the mystery of trying to see how they all played out. I will end my rating with a 5/10 solely as an enjoyment rating to factor it out to something decent. It may not really be worth a watch, but I think it had promise.

Short Summary:
Humanity was driven off the land by the threat of magical armored insects, now humanity live in aerial floating cities.
Hence wizards; aerial combat mages who fight the insects with magical powers came to be.
Age Kanata is a young man who lives at the wizard academy city of "Misutogan". He is known as the "Blacke Master Swordsman" and the elite ace of the S128 special team, however he is now despised as the "traitor of the special team".
One day, he is assigned as the instructor of E601, a team who has sufferedten consecutive defeats.\n
The three girls in this team are: Whitale Misora, Eisenach Lecty, and Flamel Rico; each with one or two peculiar behavior habits.\n\n
Gosh, that summary explained literally EVERYTHING about this anime.\n
Basically humankind was driven off the land and thus came in the use of wizards. The prodigy; Kanata is branded as a traitor before the anime started and he is placed as an instructor to the weakest team at the academy.\n\n
First of all, the reason behind why Kanata is known as a traitor is not specifically known until later on in the series (even then it might be a bit confusing but there are hints in the anime) but even then there are no specific explanations, only theories.\n\n
The thing I didn't like was the ending.\n
It just stopped out of nowhere and I'm wondering if there are plans for a second season; if there is then the ending is appropriate but still a little disappointing.\n\n
Hopefully there is a second season which goes into more depth about Kanata.\n
Other than that the series is enjoyable and I would recommend it to people who like fantasy I guess. Even for fantasy lovers I think this anime will be hard to finish cause the story is somewhat lacking and I don't even want to start with an ending.\n\n
Hopefully my questions will be answered in the OVA that is too be released.\n

If anime could give aids, this would be it.
The animation, background design, action scenes, storyline is so weak that you would think that the producers gone broke after hiring kirito's VA that they had to cut cost on every other department. Only the character design was pretty decent and I bet that's what attracts the mass audience at first along with the big oppai loli. Seriously, the devil beetles are pretty much just flying around and not doing anything and during fight scenes, tsundere redhead just goes 'ahhhh' and fires a laser beam from her sword and ends the fight. As for the other characters,apparently the animators just drag the character across the background and make explosion circles appear. Really really bad fight scenes. The whole circle explosion thing is so overused. Seriously don't watch this anime because there's no redeeming factor at all. I don't get how people think that this is good at all much less a 10/10 rating. As to why I even watch this if I thought it was so bad, well I'm one of those people that have to finish an anime even if it's bad cause I dislike dropping an anime halfway.

***May contain minor spoilers***
 Story- very poor. Seems like a copy pasted ripoff from almost any similar anime that came in the past years (and in case you missed it, there where a ton of those). Humanity is trying to survive against a mysterious entity (in this case bugs). Again, horribly overused, and unlike some other titles, doesn't add a single new thing to the formula.
Sound and art - Pretty good, not outstanding or special in any way, but good looking and pleasant to watch
Characters- Now here we get to the really bad part. All the characters in this show are so unoriginal, predictable andpretty much copy - pasted, that its simply disgusting to watch, this show makes you feel you're rewatching another one. There is a bit of an exception... The so to say ray of light in this series - the protagonist. While he's also not original in any way, he's the only one that actually has at least a tiny bit of depth and invokes any interest at all, keeping this anime watchable. Sadly, the anime is not focused on him in the slightest to the very end.\n\n
Honestly, its been a while since i saw something so shallow. The only messages in this anime sends is how awesome the power of friendship and cooperation is, and "never give up!", and not like that one is anything new, i personally got sick of hearing it over ten years ago when i was a kid watching power rangers.\n\n\n
The final verdict - 5/10, and that's just mostly for the decent art, I do NOT recommend this show to anyone, especially those of you that are over 14.

First of all, this is not the worst anime ever, It does have it's good points, but I believe that It could be better. This is what I call the "Battle Harem Flavor of the Season". Almost every season, we see a Battle Harem Anime. The plots are generally similar and characters are often completely Identical. Absolute Duo, Blade Dance of the Elementalers, Infinite Stratos, the list goes on and on. If you've seen any of these anime, you know what I'm talking about. 
Kuusen Madoushi Kouhosei no Kyoukan is one of these anime, but unlike the anime mentioned above, this fails to bring anythingto the table.


Plot 3/10: Humanity has been forced to live in floating cities because their world has been taken over by monsters. Nothing new here. Seen it before. With this Summer season playing host to God Eater, this plot has already been covered, we don't need two anime with the same story.


Art 4/10: This is probably the worst part of the show, particularly the fight scenes. The animation is poor, and battle scenes are poorly executed and are not exciting


Sound 5/10: The Sound is Average at  best. The soundtrack is unexciting and does often not fit with what is going on on Screen. The Opening is pretty good, but is not particularly exciting.


Character 4/10: Stereotypical and Bland characters do not help this anime. The characters are essentially direct clones of  Blade Dance of the Elementalers. They certainly bland and can even be annoying at times.


"Plot": More "Plot" could actually increase my enjoyment of this anime. It would break the Monotony of this bland anime. 


Overall 4/10: I'm not saying not to watch this, but don't expect anything new or particularly exciting.

TL;DR
While watching this I had such a strong feeling of deja vu I had to make sure I hadn't already seen it 3 times. In the end it was because of bad writing. While watching this I had such a strong feeling of deja vu I had to make sure I hadn't already seen it 3 times. In the end it was because of bad writing.
Story: 5
Raise your hands if you have heard this one before. An OP protagonist who is looked down upon joins a class in a battle school where people have mystic powers and fight giant CG monsters. But this time heis the teacher. Isn't that a twist! There was one interesting point to the plot where people who die with this power are forgotten. It could have been a really cool addition to the rest of the cliche story. Instead they use it as a small plot point in one of the girls story. Then it might as well have died itself, with how they forgot about it.


Art: 5

Part of me wants to rate this part a 4. All I look for in these shows are cool looking fight scenes. This show doesn't even deliver that. But it is still a 5 because the art is thoroughly average. The CG is bad, but that is to be expected. 


Sound: 4

I hate the backing soundtrack, and the OP and closing are easy to skip. The rest is pretty normal. The seiyu sound just like you expect them to. 


Character: 5

All the characters are one dimensional. They are likable due to the familiarity cliches bring me. But they do nothing themselves to make me like them. To someone who hasn't watched much anime I am sure they would find a few of the characters endearing. 


Enjoyment: 1

I did not enjoy this anime in the slightest. On an objective level, this show is not as bad as many of the other reviews make it sound. It is average, a copy of other shows that really are not that much better than it. Many of the reviews I have read rate it low because it is exactly like others of this genre. But that just makes it average, not bad. Like I said previously, when I watch these shows all I want are cool fight scenes and easy romance. This show does neither. 


Overall:5

There is no net gain or loss from this show. It is the same show you have seen plenty of times. Neither bad nor good. The more anime you watch, the more these types of shows will make you angry, but if you are at a stage in life where you are fine with mediocrity you can watch this and won't be disappointed.

I gave it a lot of thought wondering about why studios always have that one anime that is like 50 others before it and while the premise and some parts are different we have a production of a generic harem story per se. Answer it isn't for the long-time anime watchers but for new people breaking into anime from the start, well that's my opinion but onto the review.
The story setting is similar to 3 maybe 4 other animes or plots I've read in my time as a watcher, it's put together differently but this is a post-world, magic, monster-threat, weapons combat, school-life series. Thestory is set as a failure team in danger of disbanding gets assigned a new instructor, disgraced former ace fighter Kanata Age. Kanata then proceeds to use unorthodox methods to fix each of the girls flaws that prevent  them from being successful as a team despite their great potential. I won't say this story isn't unheard of or repetitive but we rarely get a teacher MC so it boosts it score a little.


The Art and animation is decent the CG goes well together but the monsters are generic and all CGed and it isn't nearly God-tier animation.


The voice acting is solid, the  opening and ending have not complaints, I suppose the one thing that annoyed me was the battle music but it wasn't that annoying.


Characters, let's start off with the failure team E601 our underdogs, Misora, tsundere red-head with a noble goal later crush on Kanata which goes unnoticed, Lecty ultra shy dual swordswoman, and Rico god-tier narcissist and master sniper with a inferiority complex to her sister. We also have Kanata's previous team, Chloe miss kind-hearted, and Lloyd other guy who is in the background, 3rd is Yuri, Kanata's original protege and while angry with him harbors deep love to him. Finally we have  our hero Kanata, known as "traitor" and "Chronos" is assigned as a teacher to E601 on Chloe's request. Kanata is probably the most fun of the series not because he is funny himself but how he trolls the other characters so well, and still fulfills his job as a teacher. To be honest I'm sure he keeps trolling Yuri too because no one is that dense, I hope. (honestly I never got the harem vibe because there is next to no romantic development between Kanata and the girls in any sense that I can see, well he does serve as a moral support but no eros or romantic stuff maybe Yuri or Misora but I'm not sure with how Kanata trolls them too) 


Enjoyment well I enjoyed the series because of the trolling done by Kanata, but people will look at the series and see it as generic and it is but that doesn't mean we can't enjoy it. Well whatever. Combat scenes are good (some actual tactics involved like bare minimum), development of characters is okay, and the premise is  decent.


Overall I give this a 6.5 but since we don't have 6.5 I rounded up, still if people are tired of repeated generic harem anime then the score is 4 and don't watch you will hate.

"How to butcher a decent novel", by Diomedea.
Kuusen Madoushi Kohousei no Kyoukan has all the traits to be considered another light novel adaptation from the pile. The synopsis is generic and has already been used (Chrome Shelled Regios meets Zettai Karen Children), there is a protagonist who used to be the strongest and has fallen out of grace for unclear reasons, surrounded by a group of girls, fighting against a relentless enemy that has apparently no reasoning capacity. However, it excels at doing the average.
The plot's intention is basically watching how our fallen elite re-educates the three little misfits. However, their personalities are not simplewhims fixable by falling for a guy voiced by Matsuoka, although there are some times where the magical wand of plot comes in to save the day, the methods are as uncommon as you would expect, and hit the root of problems that are quite realistic for a magic-based series. Of course, all in time to avoid getting the team dissolved or Kanata's ass kicked out of the corps, but then again, which series has actually made an ultimatum and taken it to the last consequences?


The characters start as pretty basic. We have Kanata Age, who falls from glory because he betrayed his original team, but still maintains a bit of arrogance and aloofness, Misora, who is a no-brain tryhard, Lecty, who is extremely timid, and Rico who is a narcissistic lazy girl. I will avoid their backgrounds in order to spoil as little as possible, but they have their reasons. Their interactions are what makes the show attractive, most times comical, a few other times emotional. They eventually grow and understand where their fault lies in the continuous defeat streak that their team is suffering, showing their hidden potential (like all underdog MC on Light Novels).


I saved the art and music for last, and here is where I get to shoot the fish in the barrel. Diomedea is a guaranteed disaster as a studio. In the summer season they could use the lack of sufficient resource allocation as an argument since they were doing four series at the same time (utter insanity in my opinion), but here, they only had this. The animation is disastrous, how do you entrust a series with flying people (which means lots of fluid movement is necessary) to these guys? The first episodes, they used badly made CG representations of the characters, which were barely bearable. Eventually they didn't even have enough money for that, so they started sliding fixed images across the screen (check the first 30 seconds of the opening to have an idea). And for the last few episodes, it seems that their only computer with flash installed broke down, since they resorted to teleporting, Dragon Ball fight style. Then the series has its assortment of wonky faces, mismatched limbs and disappearing debris, but that is par for the course, not even ufotable gets away from that. The music does not coordinate with the moments, hitting an opening-like theme on a happy atmosphere, plus the opening and ending are not too good either.


Kuusen Madoushi Kohousei no Kyoukan is not an exceptional masterpiece, nor does it pretend to be one. It sticks to the generic and does its best from there. Then came Diomedea and broke everything with their wrecking ball-like quality. If you are searching for something innovative or mentally challenging, this is not for you, this is just some good moments and growth (and a bit of fanservice, especially on the first episodes). Since I am a sucker for growth and second chances stories, it gets an overall 6, that could have been one or two points higher if any other studio had put their hands on this.

Kuusen Madoushi Kouhosei no Kyoukan also known as "Sky Wizard Academy" is one of those shows even though it had its clear problems it had obvious potential to be a enjoyable anime.
Now it was never going to be one of these shows that changed anime or that everyone was talking about but it could have been enjoyable atleast.
I say couldve because by the 12th episode it becomes a complete mess with unanswered questions, inconsistent pacing and random character personality changes.
I really wanted to like this show and if it became a harem or ecchi show like infinite stratos which also had potential but never actedon it then i couldve  atleast gone and given it credit for those kind of fans but as it is now i simply canT.


STORY


For the story im going to give it a 2 because it is just a half assed mess you can tell had next to a non existent budget.


The story follows around a group of character who are known as Sky Wizards training to be in a competitive tournament despite having never won a match.

If the story was just this then it could have been forgiven somewhat but no the decided to add in such subplots as the teacher having a redemption story, demonic beetle robots and a serial killer.


If these subplots were more fleshed out and it was a longer series giving every story element enough episodes to be focused on it would be fine but they just crammed way too much into 12 episodes.


There are just way too many plotholes and obvious questions that never get answered such as what are the devil beetles?

Why do they keep attacking?

Where did they come from?


Questions like this are never acknowledged let alone answered.

Maybe its better in the source material but as for the anime the story is one of the worst ive ever seen aside from Kill La Kill.



ART



Now the art for this series is decent i suppose, i mean it could use some work in some areas but its not horrendous and its atleast some what consistent.


The action scenes are done pretty well once again nothing amazing but good enough i suppose for a small series like this.


One thing that is done really well however is the backgrounds.

The backgrounds are so good that it almost gives off a stark contrast to the rest of the animation and designs.


SOUND


The sound for this is actually pretty well done once again nothing jaw dropping but certainly the best part of the show.


The sound effects are pretty well done being slightly above average quality and the voice acting is entertaining to listen to while being cast pretty well in my opinion.


You also have the opening which besides looking like any AMV you can find on youtube is pretty good and fits the shows feel of fast paced action.



CHARACTER


Now to talk about the characters.

Most of these characters are pretty forgetable however they do have enough features to make them stand out.


You have Kanata who is the teacher who has a stigma of being a traitor for running away from a big fight in the past despite being one of the strongest characters in the show via kirito deus ex machina secret ability.


You also have my favorite character Rico who is so full of herself that its actually pretty entertaining to watch her on screen because she is one of those characters that would normally be annoying but is so innocent and naive that it comes off as almost adoreable since nothing she says is true she just believes it is.


Finally you have Misora whos backstory actually has the best story element of this entire series because it does raise alot of good questions about life and death.

You see Misoras mother was a famous wizard like she wants to be however at a young age her mother went on a mission and died.

This would be traumatizing enough for a child but to add onto this because she was a sky wizard anybody who is normal forgets that she ever existed.

This includes her own father.


So as you can imagine this raises alot of questions on what our characters leave behind when they die and whether or not their actions will have any effect on the world or if they are just wasting their time.



ENJOYMENT


Now for this most important question, did i enjoy it?

Honestly i kind of did, dont get me wrong this show is pretty bad in terms of story telling and animation but the characters do somewhat redeem the show to a point but not enough to give it a high score or even recommend it to anybody.


It just had so much potential that it never came close to acheiving so thats why im giving it a 4/10

To start of this review I will quickly go over the setting which in simple terms in about humanity fighting an on-going threat of some sorts which is nothing new, in this case it is the Devil Beetles which are magical mechanical insects that what to exterminate humanity for an unknown reason, in which in response young people are trained in the art of killing them using a variety of tools in a highschool setting. 
Nothing really new there, there are thousands of other anime done in a similar fashion, so all I can really say is the setting is mediocre at best and doesn'treally catch the eye much.





Now for the story which is written just above; that follows Kanata Age becoming an instructor for fireteam E601; know in a nutshell this story is highly predictable and overall is quite boring if taken seriously however if it is watched purely for entertainment can become a nice popcorn show if you want to unwind for a few hours.


But as well as having a highly predictable plot the show has some really bad moments with various other sub plots being thrown in at various places that make the show into a complete mess, so much that kept forgetting what was happening as I progressed from one episode to the next. And with each of these sub plots there are more and more questions to be answered about the setting, that are never answered as well many relationships that are just left with no conclusion by the end of the show; speaking of the end of the show, there is no ending as once again it just ends on a cliff-hanger with various things unanswered, and is anything but satisfying.


Next is the animation which once again can be described as mediocre at times and really bad at others, one such example is the main enemy themselves, the Devil Beetles which are completely CGI, that not only looks bad but doesn't fit nicely with the regular animation, resulting in it standing out badly. As for the regular animation as said before is highly average but it does quite poorly during the shows supposedly high points which are the fight scenes as they feel slow and out of place. 


Thirdly I would like to talk about the soundtrack used within the show, for which firstly I'm going to say is mediocre at best, even though it does fit with the show well, its just not a good soundtrack and I found it be hardly noticeable so much as that the average viewer won't notice it unless they try to seek it out. In a similar fashion the Opening & Ending to the show are nothing to talk about as the Opening while fitting the show well and opening animation well, it just doesn't have a good enough impact to make you come back without skipping over it; this can also be said about the Ending which while a good song doesn't have a good enough impact to make you stay for the full thing. 


And finally the lowest point of the show, it's characters who are the run of the mill stereo typical rom-com harem characters. Starting with the main character Kanata Age, an overpowered dense high-schooler, with no interesting character attributes, a boring personality, no development and average design, making him a mediocre MC. Next is the four girls who are Misora Whitale, Lecty Eisenach & Rico Flamel, who are Kanta's fire team, that have a slight better score than Kanata having some development & better designs but still have the same old personalities seen in other shows; such as the Tsundere, the clumsy girl and the know it all which also applies to the 4th girl Yuri Flostre who has a good design but has a boring personality and no development. 


The supporting cast are not even worthy of mention and are highly forgettable aside from the odd one or two who help move the plot in a different direction. 


Overall if you have nothing else to watch, give this a go; however if otherwise give this one a skip.

NOTICE: Keep in mind that I do not have high standards for watching anime. It's going to take a lot of negative aspects to convince me that the anime is second-to-decent or bad or in some cases, so bad I gotta go to bathroom for a long time. :))))
Oh hey, you just read the disclaimer and you're in luck, because this anime is one of those bad animes! First of all, this is my first review, so wish me luck, and I'm super late to the party. I apologize :( Anyways, let's get with it!
STORY: 3 - So the main story of this anime iswhat I consider the generics/commons. There's these unknown enemies known as blahblahblah and select people train to be these fighters to fight them off to save the city. Sounds like a couple animes you probably know right? Yeah, this type of story is bland and boring if you don't modify or throw in some plot twists. While watching this anime, I could see that some of the story was progressing, like training the failing E601 team to become better wizards. However, the plot shifted to a tournament? It's good to have some augments that don't interfere with the main storyline as much but it directly shifted to the point of the tournament and the monsters, known as "beetles" didn't really matter until the couple last episodes. Basically, generic story is generic, and the main plot was stalled. I didn't enjoy that.


ART: 4 - The animation is ehhhhh, but I expected something more better since this is 2015. The animation looks like it was from the 2009s or lower. Heck, I think the animes from that time had even better animation than this! The fighting scenes didn't really leave an impact on me, as everything looked so boring. The CG used looked so bad that my eyes were burning (not literally), and overall didn't provide a smooth experience. Given all this, you could tell that the studio had a low budget, or they were simply lazy. Come on, you guys could've done better.


SOUND: 6 - The sound is the only thing that's good in my opinion. Nothing felt out of place, the sounds matched and blended in the situation given, and I liked Iori Nomizu's performance of the opening. The ending sort of moved me as well. 


CHARACTER: 5 - Characters received a 5 because they do variate. You've got the generic main character, Kanata, who is an excellent ace, but also a traitor. Anime like this these days tend to have a main character who is undefeated, or a traitor. We have Lecty, a girl whose shyness gets in the way of her pride and her skills, Misora, a girl who tends to not listen to anybody and has a goal to be like her mother, and Rico, a girl that thinks she is a goddess of beauty. I did see some character development throughout the anime, like Lecty overcoming her shyness and Misora improving herself to be like her mother. All in all, characters were fine, but not great.


ENJOYMENT: 3 - If you have high standards for watching anime, you can immediately forget this. It will not appeal to your expectations at all. If you're a casual or don't really give a crud about any anime you watch, be my guest and take a look!


OVERALL: 2 - So, overall this anime was garbage. I sort of regret giving it a shot. Story was painful and terrible, as well as the animation. The sounds and characters were the only factors that were decent. As I said, if you watch any kind of anime, no matter what it is, feel free to watch this.


That wraps up on my first ever review! I don't know if I did well explaining the pros and cons but whatever xD. Man, that was a pain to type.

When you write reviews in general there is one thing that you need to keep in mind, dont spoil the story but at the same time try to give your readers a reason to watch it. In this case, i dont have to worry about that becouse you see, there is nothing to spoil here becouse there are no story whatsoever to speak of.
Story:
Kanata Age, your swordsman main protagonist is recruited by the academy to train 3 girls to fight the big ass bugs for a reason we never learn, i guess they want to conquer the world or something. So thats it, nothing morenothing less, you wont see more progress in the story department. I could have easily copied MALs own summery but that would be cheap. Characters:


Did i just say characters? well sorry, not in this one. The 3 girls he trains is your typical harem trophes you have seen a million times before. Move on.


Art and sound:


The only redeeming quality is its looks, good looking girls, your typical guy with a big fat sword


Conclusion:


I dont hate this show, i just dont like it. There is nothing for me to hate, there is no plot advancement whatsoever so bitching about a plot that does not exist is kind of hard. Sky wizards academy is just stupid and it does not need to even exist becouse it does not contribute to anything.

- Hello, guys, finally my review of Kuusen Madoushi Kouhosei in Kyoukan, starting with the story that although interesting, unfortunately was not very well executed, besides having several problems of script and some exaggerations in some scenes, and unfortunately this bothers, but despite of all that, I still liked the story, it's a very good story for someone who is looking for something to just pass the time, but it was a story that had a lot of potential but unfortunately was wasted.
- On the technical part, which is one of the strongest points of the work, the technical part is simply excellent, the animationis very good, but what stands out even is the look that is simply magnificent, are firm features and vibrant colors; already the direction does not stand out much, not bad, just does the basics.


- Now about the soundtrack, which is another strong point of the work, the soundtrack is very good and very well used, as well as the sound effects, I loved the way they used, it helped to give more impact to the different scenes, in short, without doubts one of the strongest points of the work.


- About the characters, without doubt is the strongest point of the work, the cast is simply excellent, are very charismatic characters and well developed, especially the protagonists, but the highlight is the main heroines: Lecty, Misora ​​and Rico, both are extremely charismatic, and have an excellent development during the series, but the secondary characters are also very good, in short, the cast of Kuusen Madoushi is simply excellent.


- Conclusion, Kuusen Madoushi has some problems such as: history with potential lost, script problems, doubtful direction, plus some exaggerations in some scenes, the series has several problems but also has several good points such as a great technical part, a excellent soundtrack, in addition to very charismatic characters, in short, Kuusen Madoushi is like any other anime, has its positives and negatives, but in general, it is an anime that I liked a lot, and highly recommend to anyone looking for a simple anime to pass the time 😉💜😊💕💐 !!

Disappointing.
I knew exactly what to expect when I started watching this anime and though nothing is original about the story, or the characters, I have always enjoyed anime like this. 
So its a typical school type setting where the worst students are given an outcast teacher to help them improve or face expulsion. Add to that the girls are cute, have super powers and have to battle other students. So when it comes time for the annual school battle, the girls as expected compete and prove to everyone they aren't the losers everyone thought they were. Brilliant, seen heaps of anime just like it andloved most of them.


However in this waste of a time anime, instead of devoting the main portion of the series to the tournament and the fight scenes (which is the best part of these types of anime), they only show the very first match and then in the next episode jump straight to the tournament final. WTF... How can you leave out the battles, the hard fought victories, the pulling a win from the jaws of defeat???

There was hardly any time spent on training episodes either and even though this series was only 12 eps, they managed to add generic space filler episodes like the girls working in a maid cafe.


Very annoyed at this series as it could have been so much better. 


If you like the magic/fighting school genre anime, you might like to check out these.

Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry - 8/10

Seiken Tsukai no World Break - 7/10

Gakusen Toshi Asterisk - 6.5/10

Absolute Duo - 6/10

Hundred - 6/10
